I feel this game is a cross between the shooting and the shop slection of Counter Strike and the source engine of Battlefield or Arma. However, i can tell where this game is going with its MOBA FPS gameplay with its special abilities like tempory armor, stimulated healing, Slow-mo bullet time, and even the ability to push and pull objects and players. Currently, the shop contains: Primary weapons, secondary weapons, explosives, and two slots for abilities and so far i can tell that they will add armor including helmets, body armor, gloves that will increase stats and what looks like to be equipment.
Of course the game has bugs, what else do you expect from a Pre-Alfa game, but that does not take away its playability. I play PC games with a laptop not made for gameing having only 4 gb of RAM, but i am still able to play this game with my friends on its lowest settings with slight lag. Just from the menu screen you can tell its a Early Access Game, but once youre in a sever you can feel the decitation and the hard work put into it. Things that i have found playing this game that could use work is:
-The players movement so it doesnt look the people are swimming (Which i actually find amusing while trying to shoot mermaids) and also the couch machanic so you dont bounce up and down a bit before settling down.
-A more user friendly menu screen (eventhough i've found my way around already).
-A better hub to make health and ammo easier to observe.

Honestly, these bugs and improvements dont bother me a bit as they are now, but these fixes will help to make a complete and finished game. Some might wonder why im not complaing that there are not enough items in the shop or that the stats of the guns are unbalanced, well that's because if didn't, it wouldnt be a Early Access Game!

I bought a four pack of this game to share with my friends and we have enjoyed every bit of it and are convinced that this game has what it takes to hit it big. Im happy that i can support this game and follow it as it the community grows and a new genre is prefected. 10/10

The mouse controls are very awkward. I have an 800 DPI mouse on a 1920x1080 screen and there doesn't seem to be much modulation. Its either way to fast or way to slow. I do have to say the assets and graphics are pretty stunning for a game of this budget. The actual physics of the gun play are a bit odd. Sort of like CS, battlefield and COD combined like an all season tire. Jack of all trades master of none.

Bottom line verdict. Don't pick this up if your expecting COD or a AAA title and are going to complain about the 1 dollar you spent. Pick this up on sale for a buck and see where it goes. Expect nothing and hope for the best. This game is very young and is in the alpha stage without much funding so again you have to be patient with some errors. I don't mind the bugs but and just trying to throw this out there.

I would rate this game a 8.5/10 for a great time.

This game has soooooooooo much potential, if the multiplayer community would thrive, and the devs would work hard enough at it (as if they arn't already doing so) then this game could be transformed into a triple A looking title. Some recomendations!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has a lot of potential. Looks good, optimization isn't too bad, amazing reload animations, easy to pick up gameplay, and just fun to play. Now the bad side. The menue's defintely need some improvement. The function perfectly, they just don't look to good, nothing is labled (it is still pretty easy to figure out what is what, if you passed middle school and have played any fps, you should be able to figure it out) and they are low res, but still functional. Some more detailed options would be nice, especially for the graphics. There is only a low, medium, high, and ultra setting, you can't change anything else. Sometimes jumping can get a little glitchy, but most of the time it is fine. Movement seems pretty good. Character models aren't bad. And other peoples movements don't seem glitchy. AI are fine, except on one map. You can make a cargo crate fall, and the AI try to walk through it. The guns sound good and look good. There just isn't a lot of them. Some more guns would be nice. And the rocket strike doesn't seem to be working. But everything else seems to be fine. Some more abilities would be nice, since this game is striving to be a MOBA/FPS. And the belt thing (I can't remember the name at the moment) that can push objects and stuff should be made to be able to pick stuff up and move it around, kind if like in GMod. Because there isn't a whole lot of usefullness with it, maybe if the enemy took the time to make a position with boxes you could destroy it, other than that there isn't really a whole lot of use for it othere than messing around and distracting people. But i do like the fact that boxes and pallets and stuff are moveable. There are also some cool enviromental hazards. And I definetly see where the MOBA aspects come in. Also, I don't know if it is the matchmaking or there are just not a lot of people playing, but i don't find more than maybe one or two people at times. Overall, I do recommend this game. It is only in Aplha and I thing that there are going to be updates and that this game will vastly be improved. And for the price, it is on sale for a little over a dollar, very much worth it to me. My friend picked up five copies for around $5, and gave me one. Definetly worth it.
Update: since update, new maps, much much better menu and hud. Optimization is soooo mmuucch better. I have a GTX 750 and I am running it on max settings (which look amazing by the way) at 60 fps. AI is a lot better, and servers have gotten better (ping). Still not too many people, but still a blast to play. Ignore a lot of the reviews. As they are old and before some of the updates came out. This game shows a lot of promise.

Early Access Review

This game has a lot of potential. Looks good, optimization isn't too bad, amazing reload animations, easy to pick up gameplay, and just fun to play. Now the bad side. The menue's defintely need some improvement. The function perfectly, they just don't look to good, nothing is labled (it is still pretty easy to figure out what is what, if you passed middle school and have played any fps, you should be able to figure it out) and they are low res, but still functional. Some more detailed options would be nice, especially for the graphics. There is only a low, medium, high, and ultra setting, you can't change anything else. Sometimes jumping can get a little glitchy, but most of the time it is fine. Movement seems pretty good. Character models aren't bad. And other peoples movements don't seem glitchy. AI are fine, except on one map. You can make a cargo crate fall, and the AI try to walk through it. The guns sound good and look good. There just isn't a lot of them. Some more guns would be nice. And the rocket strike doesn't seem to be working. But everything else seems to be fine. Some more abilities would be nice, since this game is striving to be a MOBA/FPS. And the belt thing (I can't remember the name at the moment) that can push objects and stuff should be made to be able to pick stuff up and move it around, kind if like in GMod. Because there isn't a whole lot of usefullness with it, maybe if the enemy took the time to make a position with boxes you could destroy it, other than that there isn't really a whole lot of use for it othere than messing around and distracting people. But i do like the fact that boxes and pallets and stuff are moveable. There are also some cool enviromental hazards. And I definetly see where the MOBA aspects come in. Also, I don't know if it is the matchmaking or there are just not a lot of people playing, but i don't find more than maybe one or two people at times. Overall, I do recommend this game. It is only in Aplha and I thing that there are going to be updates and that this game will vastly be improved. And for the price, it is on sale for a little over a dollar, very much worth it to me. My friend picked up five copies for around $5, and gave me one. Definetly worth it.
Update: since update, new maps, much much better menu and hud. Optimization is soooo mmuucch better. I have a GTX 750 and I am running it on max settings (which look amazing by the way) at 60 fps. AI is a lot better, and servers have gotten better (ping). Still not too many people, but still a blast to play. Ignore a lot of the reviews. As they are old and before some of the updates came out. This game shows a lot of promise.

Still have no idea what the chain upgrade does. (maybe make some little information buttons beside the upgrade buttons)
Some games just turn into spawn camping. (maybe make some invincability as you spawn for a short period)
